p: Whiteflies were able to acquire the virus from infected plants regardless of the genotype for all time periods ( Fig 4). In general, whiteflies acquired more TYLCV copies from TYLCV-susceptible genotypes than from TYLCV-resistant genotypes at 3 ( F = 5.31; df = 5, 27; P = 0.0020), 6 ( F = 10.43; df = 5, 30, P<0.0001), and 12 ( F = 4.11; df = 5, 28; P = 0.0070) WPI, respectively. Accumulation of TYLCV in whiteflies following a 72h AAP on TYLCV-susceptible genotypes was up to three orders of magnitude greater than in whiteflies that were given an AAP on TYLCV-resistant genotypes. However, the ability of whiteflies to acquire the virus from infected plants of susceptible or resistant genotypes was not influenced by the time of inoculation ( Fig 4).
